title: What do I need to do if I received a motion on motion for relief from automatic stay on a car, but I have no intention to own.
question: I want to surrender the vehicle, do I need to attend the hearing on the Relief from automatic stay?
answers: Call up the attorney who filed the motion and arrange to return the car. There is no reason for you to attend the hearing.

No. You'd only need to attend the hearing if you opposed the motion and wanted to argue that the court should not "lift the stay" as to that creditor.

You may want to check your filing to determine if you stated that you would be surrendering the car. It may be that you did not indicate that you would surrender it, and so the creditor is now taking steps (with the motion for relief from the stay) to take possession of that car.
